abilities.name: Flare Condition
abilities.text: As long as Arcanine has any Fire Energy attached to it, Arcanine has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Burn Out
attacks.text: You may do 30 damage plus 30 more damage. If you do, Arcanine is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flames of Rage
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Arcanine. This attack does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Arcanine.

attacks.name: Incite
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Supporter cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Giant Wave
attacks.text: Floatzel GL can't use Giant Wave during your next turn.

attacks.name: Bounce Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Smack Attack
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Bastiodon GL.

abilities.name: Eerie Aura
abilities.text: Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon that remains Asleep between turns.

attacks.name: Darkness Sleep
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, that Pokémon is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Rainbow Float
abilities.text: If any basic Energy card attached to Flygon is the same type as any of your Pokémon, the Retreat Cost for those Pokémon is 0.

attacks.name: Sand Wall
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium card your opponent has in play. If you do, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Flygon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Power Swing
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each Evolved Pokémon on your Bench.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Wake-Up Slap
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by any Special Conditions, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. Then, remove all Special Conditions from the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Final Wish
abilities.text: Once during your opponent's turn, if Jirachi would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, you may search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Detour
attacks.text: If you have a Supporter card in play, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Boundary Aura
abilities.text: Apply Weakness for each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) as ×2 instead.

attacks.name: Combo Throw
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Trash Bolt
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card from your hand. (If you can't discard a card from your hand, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Psychic Removal
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, discard all Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grudge
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

abilities.name: Unlucky Wind
abilities.text: As long as Shiftry is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent flips a coin during his or her turn, treat it as tails.

attacks.name: Conform
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Seal Off
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Trample
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). If that coin flip is heads, this attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Poison Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Long Whip
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by any Special Conditions, you may do 30 damage to any 1 Benched Pokémon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Beedrill
data.flavorText: Its best attack involves flying around at high speed, striking with poison needles, then flying off.

abilities.name: Flutter Wings
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Beedrill is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Needle Shock
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. Ignore this effect if any of your Pokémon used Needle Shock during your last turn.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Return Blow
attacks.text: If Aggron was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does the same amount of damage done to Aggron to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Metal Fang
attacks.text: You may discard the top card of your deck. If you do, remove 2 damage counters and all Special Conditions from Aggron.

attacks.name: Hand Refresh
attacks.text: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws up to 4 cards. (You draw your cards first.)

attacks.name: Payback
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 10 damage plus 50 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Undevelop
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may devolve Flareon and put Flareon into your hand. This power can't be used if Flareon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Evolving Flare
attacks.text: If Flareon evolved from Eevee during this turn, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Chop Up
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Feint
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Sticky Hold
abilities.text: If Gastrodon East Sea is switched or retreats to your Bench, move as many Energy cards attached to Gastrodon East Sea as you like to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Calling Wave
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Gastrodon and put them onto your Bench as Basic Pokémon. Put 2 damage counters on each of them. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Muddy Bomb
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon and 10 damage to each of your opponent's other Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Raging Sea
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Golem GL.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Golem E4 does 60 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Heracross E4's Megahorn attack's base damage is 100.

attacks.name: Megahorn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Sand Cover
abilities.text: As long as Hippowdon is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon LV.X between turns.

attacks.name: Save Sand
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Hippowdon. Before doing damage, you may search your discard pile for a Fighting Energy card and attach it to Hippowdon.

attacks.name: Groundquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon that isn't an Evolved Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon).

abilities.name: Undevelop
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may devolve Jolteon and put Jolteon into your hand. This power can't be used if Jolteon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Evolving Thunder
attacks.text: If Jolteon evolved from Eevee during this turn, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon).

abilities.name: Icy Aura
abilities.text: As long as Mamoswine GL is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each Active Pokémon (excluding Water Pokémon) (both yours and your opponent's) between turns.

attacks.name: Avalanche
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Magic Heal
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. Remove a number of damage counters equal to the number of heads from your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Barrier Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Mr. Mime E4 by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

abilities.name: Territoriality
abilities.text: If your Active Pokémon is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon. You can't put more than 2 damage counters in this way.

attacks.name: Fling Away
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, this attack's base damage is 30 instead of 60 and this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Giga Horn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Maternal Comfort
abilities.text: At any times between turns, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Maternal Comfort Poké-Body between turns.

attacks.name: Ruthless Tail
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Throw
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Repeat Lightning
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Double Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Snorlax
data.flavorText: It stops eating only to sleep. It doesn't feel full unless it eats nearly 900 pounds a day.

attacks.name: Pick and Collect
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 4 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Roll Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, both Snorlax and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep. If tails, Snorlax is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Undevelop
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may devolve Vaporeon and put Vaporeon into your hand. This power can't be used if Vaporeon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Evolving Aqua
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If Vaporeon evolved from Eevee during this turn, this attack does 60 damage instead.

abilities.name: Royal Gain
abilities.text: When you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Vespiquen E4, remove 1 damage counter from Vespiquen E4.

attacks.name: Leaf Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Grass Energy attached to Vespiquen E4. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Walrein
data.flavorText: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.

abilities.name: Gather Ice
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you play Walrein from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may attach as many Water Energy cards from your hand to Walrein as you like.

attacks.name: Cold Crush
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Walrein and then discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard a Psychic Energy attached to Alakazam E4 and remove 4 damage counters from Alakazam E4.

attacks.name: Mysterious Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Reckless Bomb
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Electrode G does 100 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to Electrode G to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Frost Wind
abilities.text: As long as Glaceon is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by your opponent's attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Ice Blade
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Ice Bind
attacks.text: If your opponent doesn't discard a card from his or her hand, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Attack and Hide
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. You may shuffle Gengar GL and all cards attached to it back into your deck.

abilities.name: Sand Armor
abilities.text: If Hippowdon E4 has any Fighting Energy attached to it, any damage done to Hippowdon E4 by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Bite and Crush
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Lairon
data.flavorText: For food, it digs up iron ore. It smashes its steely body against others to fight over territory.

attacks.name: Heavy Metal
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Metal Energy attached to Lairon. This attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Granite Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Lairon by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

abilities.name: Energy Refresh
abilities.text: As long as Leafeon is your Active Pokémon, whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, remove 2 damage counters from that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Plus Energy
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Pickup Power
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

attacks.name: Crushing Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Aqua Recycle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a Water Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. This power can't be used if Starmie is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Synchro Gain
attacks.text: If Starmie and the Defending Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, remove 4 damage counters from Starmie.

attacks.name: Powerful Spin
attacks.text: Starmie can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Brush Off
attacks.text: Put the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it on top of your opponent's deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward. (If your opponent doesn't have any Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing.)

abilities.name: Energy Shark
abilities.text: If Sharpedo is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Sharpedo is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: If an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 40 more damage to that Pokémon until the end of your next turn.

attacks.name: Mend
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Metal Energy card and attach it to Steelix GL. If you do, remove 1 damage counter from Steelix GL.

attacks.name: Squeeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 50 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Tropius during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Blessed Fruit
attacks.text: Remove all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Grass Pokémon.

data.name: Vibrava
data.flavorText: It violently shudders its wings, generating ultrasonic waves to induce headaches in people.

attacks.name: Energy Typhoon
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards in your opponent's discard pile. Then, put those Energy cards on top of your opponent's deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Sleep Pulse
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Primal Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Pokémon from his or her hand to Evolve or to Level-Up the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Tail Code
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Snap Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 60.

data.name: Aron
data.flavorText: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Carvanha
data.flavorText: They swarm any foes that invades their territory. Their sharp fangs can tear out boat hulls.

attacks.name: Scary Face
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack or retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Loaded Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Because its genetic makeup is irregular, it quickly changes its form due to a variety of causes.

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards that evolve from Eevee, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: Switch Eevee with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Tail Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Flareon .

attacks.name: Shell Scatter
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Forretress G can't use Shell Scatter during your next turn.

attacks.name: Bomb Risk
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Flip a coin. If tails, Forretress G does 80 damage to itself.

data.name: Hippopotas
data.flavorText: It shuts its nostrils tight then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around ten.

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Endeavor
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: A Pokémon with a loyal nature. It will remain motionless until it is given an order by its Trainer.

attacks.name: Stoke
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to Growlithe. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Growlithe does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Munchlax
data.flavorText: In its desperation to gulp down food, it forgets about the food it has hidden under its fur.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Snorlax from your hand onto Munchlax (this counts as evolving Munchlax) and remove all damage counters from Munchlax.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 6 damage counters from Munchlax. Munchlax is now Asleep.

data.name: Kecleon
data.flavorText: It can freely change its body's color. The zigzag pattern on its belly doesn't change, however.

abilities.name: Colorful Body
abilities.text: Kecleon's type is Grass Fire Water Lightning Psychic Fighting Darkness Metal Colorless.

attacks.name: Triple Smash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Koffing
data.flavorText: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.

attacks.name: Offensive Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Gas Bomb
attacks.text: Koffing does 30 damage to itself, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

data.name: Kakuna
data.flavorText: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Kakuna by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Dangerous Evolution
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for an Evolution card that evolves from Kakuna and put it onto Kakuna. (This counts as evolving Kakuna.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Nidoran ♀
data.flavorText: While it does not prefer to fight, even one drop of the poison it secretes from barbs can be fatal.

attacks.name: Offer Help
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Munchlax
data.flavorText: It hides food under its long body hair. However, it forgets it has hidden the food.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Snorlax from your hand onto Munchlax (this counts as evolving Munchlax) and remove all damage counters from Munchlax.

attacks.name: Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Nidoran ♂
data.flavorText: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Nidorina
data.flavorText: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than NIDORINO's.

attacks.name: Jump Tackle
attacks.text: Nidorina does 10 damage to itself, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

attacks.name: Stress Poison
attacks.text: If Nidorina has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Nidorino
data.flavorText: It has a violent disposition and stabs foes with its horn, which oozes poison upon impact.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Frustration
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that doesn't have any damage counters on it. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Nuzleaf
data.flavorText: The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners uneasy. It lives deep in forests.

attacks.name: Blind
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.name: Sealeo
data.flavorText: It habitually spins things on its nose. By doing so, it learns textures and odors.

attacks.name: Find Ice
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Water Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Sheer Cold
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as Quagsire GL is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Quagsire GL by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Punch and Run
attacks.text: You may switch Quagsire GL with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Seedot
data.flavorText: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if Seedot would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Seedot if that damage is 40 or less.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at that card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

data.name: Shellos East Sea
data.flavorText: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.

attacks.name: Ripple
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Brine
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Shellos West Sea
data.flavorText: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.

attacks.name: Healing Sea
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. Choose 1 of your Pokémon. For each heads, remove 1 damage counter from that Pokémon.

abilities.name: Bad Sleeping Habits
abilities.text: As long as Snorlax is Asleep, your opponent's Active Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Toss and Turn
attacks.text: If Snorlax is Asleep, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage. (This attack can be used even if Snorlax is Asleep.)

attacks.name: Heavy Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage. If tails, Snorlax is now Asleep.

data.name: Staryu
data.flavorText: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.

attacks.name: Cosmic Draw
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Evolved Pokémon in play, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Spheal
data.flavorText: It rolls across ice floes to reach shore because its body is poorly shaped for swimming.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Trapinch
data.flavorText: It makes a conical pit in desert sand and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.

abilities.name: Gather Sand
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Trapinch is your Active Pokémon, you may search your discard pile for a basic Fighting card and attach it to Trapinch.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Trapinch.

abilities.name: Overgrow
abilities.text: As long as Turtwig GL's remaining HP is 60 or less, each of Turtwig GL's attacks does 30 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: After your attack, remove from Turtwig GL the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Weedle
data.flavorText: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.

attacks.name: Rescue String
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 5 Pokémon, show them to your opponent, and shuffle them into your deck.

attacks.name: Needling Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Aaron's Collection
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your discard pile for up to 2 in any combination of Pokémon SP and basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

abilities.name: Camouflage Gas
abilities.text: If Weezing is Confused and is Knocked Out, your opponent can't take a Prize card.

attacks.name: Damage Breakdown
attacks.text: Count the number of damage counters on Weezing. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon and Weezing is now Confused.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Bebe's Search
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

Choose a card from your hand and put it on top of your deck. Search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. (If this is the only card in your hand, you can't play this card.)

data.name: Flint's Willpower
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon SP.

data.name: Bertha's Warmth
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Remove 5 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon SP.

data.name: Underground Expedition
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Look at the 4 cards from the bottom of your deck. Choose any 2 cards there and put them into your hand. Put the remaining cards back on the bottom of your deck in any order.

data.name: Metal Energy
rules: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Team Galactic's Invention G-107 Technical Machine G
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon SP in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. When the Pokémon this card is attached to is no longer Pokémon SP, discard this card.

attacks.name: Damage Porter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on the Pokémon this card is attached to to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: SP Energy
rules: SP Energy provides Colorless Energy. If the Pokémon SP Energy is attached to is a Pokémon SP, SP Energy provides every type of Energy buy provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Pokémon Contest Hall
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

Once during each player's turn, if that player's Bench isn't full, the player may flip a coin. If heads, that player searches his or her deck for a Basic Pokémon and puts it onto his or her Bench. If the player does, he or she may search his or her deck for a Pokémon Tool card and attach it to that Pokémon. If that player searched his or her deck, the player shuffles his or her deck afterward.

data.name: Lucian's Assignment
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Move as many Energy cards attached to 1 of your Pokémon as you like to another of your Pokémon.

data.name: Sunyshore City Gym
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

Any damage done by attacks from Lightning Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) to the Defending Pokémon isn't affected by Resistance. Each Lightning Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) has no Weakness.

data.name: Team Galactic's Invention G-109 SP Radar
rules: Choose a card from your hand and put it on top of your deck. Search your deck for a Pokémon SP, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. (If this is the only card in your hand, you can't play this card.)

data.name: Volkner's Philosophy
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
You may discard a card from your hand. Then, draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. (If you can't draw any cards, you can't play this card.)

data.name: Darkness Energy
rules: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Darkness Energy is attached to isn't Darkness. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Upper Energy
rules: Upper Energy provides Colorless Energy. If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent and this card is attached to a Pokémon (excluding Pokémon LV.X), Upper Energy provides ColorlessColorless.

data.name: Alakazam E4 LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Alakazam E4. Alakazam E4 LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Damage Switch
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon SP to another of your Pokémon SP. This power can't be used if Alakazam E4 is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Gallade E4 LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Gallade E4. Gallade E4 LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Blade Storm
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Gallade E4 LV.X from your hand onto your Active Gallade E4, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aimed Cut
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Flygon LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Flygon. Flygon LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Wind Erosion
abilities.text: As long as Flygon is your Active Pokémon, discard the top card from your opponent's deck between turns.

attacks.name: Extreme Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon LV.X. This attack does 150 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon).

data.name: Hippowdon LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Hippowdon. Hippowdon LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Sand Reset
abilities.text: Once during a game on your turn (before your attack), each player shuffles all cards in play (excluding Pokémon and Supporter cards) into his or her deck. You can't use more than 1 Sand Reset Poké-Power each game.

attacks.name: Double Shoot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fighting Energy attached to Hippowdon and choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Floatzel GL LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Floatzel GL. Floatzel GL LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Water Rescue
abilities.text: Whenever any of your Water Pokémon (excluding any Floatzel GL) is Knocked Out by damage from your opponent's attack, you may put that Pokémon and all cards that were attached to it from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Energy Cyclone
attacks.text: Choose as many Energy cards from your hand as you like and show them to your opponent. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards you chose. Put those Energy cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Luxray GL LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Luxray GL. Luxray GL LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Bright Look
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Luxray GL LV.X from your hand onto your Active Luxray GL, you may switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flash Impact
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokémon, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

data.name: Infernape E4 LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Infernape E4. Infernape E4 LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Intimidating Roar
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Infernape E4 is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Infernape E4.

data.name: Mismagius GL LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Mismagius GL. Mismagius GL LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Magical Return
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may return a Pokémon Tool or Technical Machine card attached to your Pokémon to your hand. This power can't be used if Mismagius GL is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Darkness Magic
attacks.text: Count the number of cards in your hand. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. You can't put more than 8 damage counters in this way.

data.name: Snorlax LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Snorlax. Snorlax LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Big Appetite
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Snorlax is your Active Pokémon, you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. If you do, Snorlax is now Asleep. This power can't be used if Snorlax is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Exercise
attacks.text: You may discard as many Energy cards as you like from your hand. If you do, remove that many damage counters from Snorlax.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. If threatened, it looses electric charges from the sacs.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Pikachu does 10 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Fan Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Fan Rotom's type is Colorless until the end of your turn.

attacks.name: Spin Storm
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent returns the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to his or her hand.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to Fan Rotom.

abilities.name: Heat Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Heat Rotom's type is Fire until the end of your turn.

attacks.name: Warm Up
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Heat Burn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

abilities.name: Mow Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Mow Rotom's type is Grass until the end of your turn.

attacks.name: Mow Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to each of your opponent's Pokémon.

abilities.name: Frost Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Frost Rotom's type is Water until the end of your turn.

attacks.name: Hail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Crushing Ice
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Colorless Energy in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost).

data.name: Flying Pikachu
data.flavorText: By learning how to fly, Pikachu overcame its weakness to Fighting Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Flying Pikachu during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Surfing Pikachu
data.flavorText: One summer, a group of Pikachu was found riding the waves at the local beach.

abilities.name: Wash Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Wash Rotom's type is Water until the end of your turn.

attacks.name: Cleanse Away
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Drain Wash
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

data.name: Charon's Choice
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, put this card into your hand instead of discarding it.

Search your deck for any Rotom and switch it with any Rotom you have in play. Any cards attached to Rotom and damage counters on it are now on the new Pokémon. (Remove all Special Conditions and effects from Rotom.) Put Rotom on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.
